pages.title: Page 1: Understanding Deployment in the SDLC
pages.content:
Mentor Introduction

Say with energy: â€œYouâ€™ve built something real â€” now letâ€™s take it live! Today, youâ€™ll learn how to ship like a pro.â€

Objective

  • Understand what deployment means in a real-world SDLC
  • Learn how frontend and backend hosting differ
  • See how AI can guide troubleshooting

Mentor Explanation

Explain: â€œDeployment is how we turn code into a product users can access.â€ Draw the flow on board:

Local â†’ GitHub â†’ Build â†’ Host â†’ Live URL

Show how Vercel automates builds, and Render/Railway host APIs or databases.

Mentor Demo (10 min)

  1. Open Vercel.com and show dashboard.
  2. Click New Project â†’ Import GitHub Repo.
  3. Explain what Vercel does behind the scenes (pulls code â†’ build â†’ serve).

Class Discussion

Ask: â€œWhy is â€˜Deploy early, deploy oftenâ€™ a good habit?â€ â†’ emphasize feedback loops and confidence.

Deliverable

âœ… Students draw deployment flow in their notebooks or Miro boards.

pages.title: Page 2: Environment Variables & Secrets
pages.content:
Mentor Setup

Say: â€œSome data should never be shared â€” like your API keys. Thatâ€™s where environment variables come in.â€

Goal

  • Understand what .env files do
  • Learn safe handling of API keys and tokens

Mentor Demo (10 min)

In Cursor, create a file:

.env.local
OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-examplekeyhere
DATABASE_URL=postgres://example

Then in code:

const apiKey = process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY;
console.log('Using key:', apiKey ? 'Loaded âœ…' : 'Missing âŒ');

Important Note

  • Never commit .env files to GitHub â€“ add to .gitignore.
  • In Vercel: Project â†’ Settings â†’ Environment Variables â†’ add key/value.

Student Exercise (10 min)

  1. Create .env.local with one fake key.
  2. Add it to .gitignore.
  3. Push repo and verify file is excluded on GitHub.

Mentor Tip

Show what happens if you expose keys (public API ban example) â†’ it sticks with students.

Deliverable

âœ… .env set up locally and securely ignored in repo.

pages.title: Page 3: Hosting Options Simplified (Frontend vs Backend)
pages.content:
Mentor Introduction

Say: â€œThere are many ways to host â€” but letâ€™s focus on the simplest and most reliable for students.â€

Objective

  • Differentiate between frontend and backend hosting
  • Pick a platform for each
  • Use AI to decide which fits your project

Quick Comparison Table

TypePlatformBest For
FrontendVercelNext.js, React, Tailwind apps
BackendRenderNode.js or Express APIs
BackendRailwayPython, Postgres, API testing

Mentor Demo (10 min)

Prompt ChatGPT:

I built a Next.js app with a mock API. Should I deploy both to Vercel or split frontend and backend between Vercel and Render?

Show how AI recommends split deployments for scalability and ease of debugging.

Discussion

Ask: â€œWhatâ€™s the risk of hosting everything in one place?â€ â†’ guide them toward understanding separation of concerns.

Deliverable

âœ… Students choose their hosting stack (Vercel + Render or Vercel only) and note it in their README.

pages.title: Page 4: Deploying the Frontend on Vercel
pages.content:
Mentor Introduction

Say: â€œYouâ€™ve seen Vercel before â€” now letâ€™s use it to launch your app for real. By the end of this session, everyone will have a live link!â€

Objective

  • Deploy project from GitHub to Vercel
  • Verify live build and troubleshoot errors

Mentor Demo (10 min)

  1. Go to Vercel.com â†’ Login with GitHub.
  2. Click New Project â†’ Import Repo.
  3. Pick student repo (e.g., ai-notes-app).
  4. Set framework: Next.js â†’ Deploy.
  5. Wait 1â€“2 minutes â†’ show live link: https://ai-notes.vercel.app.

Mentor Tip

Encourage: â€œDonâ€™t panic if you see red! Red means learning.â€

Common Issues

  • Build Failed: Missing dependency â†’ fix package.json and redeploy.
  • 404: Wrong export default or routing setup.
  • Blank Page: JavaScript error â†’ check console logs.

Student Hands-On (25 min)

  1. Deploy own app on Vercel via GitHub import.
  2. Verify live build (check mobile + desktop).
  3. Copy the public link and paste into README.md under â€œLive Previewâ€.

Mentor Reflection

Ask: â€œWhat felt most satisfying about seeing your live link?â€ â€” let a few students share their moment of joy.

Deliverable

âœ… Live app on Vercel
âœ… Updated README.md with live link
âœ… Commit: docs: add vercel link

pages.title: Page 5: Deploying Backend or Mock API on Render/Railway (Optional)
pages.content:
Mentor Opening

Say: â€œSome of you used mock APIs â€” letâ€™s deploy them too, so your data works everywhere.â€

Objective

  • Deploy backend or mock JSON server online
  • Learn Render & Railway basics
  • Connect live backend with frontend

Mentor Demo (10 min)

Option 1 â€” Render

  1. Go to render.com â†’ Login with GitHub.
  2. New + Web Service â†’ Select your repo.
  3. Set Build Command: npm install && npm start.
  4. Deploy â†’ wait â†’ copy live URL (e.g., https://ai-api.onrender.com).

Option 2 â€” Railway

  1. Go to railway.app â†’ Login with GitHub.
  2. Click New Project â†’ Deploy from GitHub.
  3. Once live, open API link and test endpoints.

Student Hands-On (25 min)

  1. Students with backends: deploy using Render/Railway.
  2. Frontend-only students: skip but help a peer.
  3. Update frontend code to fetch from new API URL.

Mentor Tip

Explain: â€œEvery professional engineer deploys small parts independently â€” front, back, and docs are all separate builds.â€

Deliverable

âœ… Backend/API live URL
âœ… Frontend connected to live data
âœ… Commit: chore: connect live API endpoint

pages.title: Page 6: Debugging & Testing Live Builds
pages.content:
Mentor Setup

Say: â€œWeâ€™re live! Now itâ€™s time to act like QA engineers â€” test, break, fix, repeat.â€

Objective

  • Test live app on multiple devices
  • Debug common build issues using AI
  • Document and fix deployment bugs

Mentor Demo (10 min)

Open live site and intentionally cause an error (e.g., wrong API URL). Show how to use ChatGPT for help:

My Vercel deployment shows a blank screen. Console log: 'Cannot read properties of undefined (reading map)'.
Whatâ€™s the cause and how to fix it?

Show how AI breaks down the issue: root cause â†’ solution â†’ test step.

Student Activity (25 min)

  1. Visit their own deployed app link.
  2. Test on mobile, tablet, and desktop.
  3. Write one bug report in ISSUES.md (new file in repo).
  4. Use ChatGPT/Claude to find fixes.
  5. Deploy updated version to confirm fix.

Mentor Tip

Encourage honesty â€” â€œFinding bugs means youâ€™re improving.â€
Have 2â€“3 students share a funny or interesting bug they encountered.

Deliverable

âœ… Tested and debugged live build
âœ… 1 Issue logged and fixed
âœ… Commit: fix: resolved deployment bugs

pages.title: Page 7: Document Your Project Like a Pro
pages.content:
Mentor Introduction

Say: â€œGreat work getting your app live! Now letâ€™s make it look professional â€” your README is your resume.â€

Objective

  • Write a clear and visual README.md
  • Add screenshots and deployment links
  • Make your project portfolio-ready

Mentor Demo (10 min)

Show an example README:

# ğŸ¤– Quote Generator

My second AI Engineering project built with Next.js + Tailwind CSS. Generates random quotes using AI and animations.

## ğŸš€ Live Link
https://quote-ai.vercel.app

## ğŸ§  What I Learned
- How to deploy on Vercel
- How to use .env safely
- How to debug with AI copilots

## ğŸ–¼ Screenshot
![Preview](public/screenshots/quote.png)

## ğŸ›  Stack
- Next.js 14
- TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS
- Vercel

## ğŸ¤ Built With AI
- Code: Cursor
- Design: V0
- Debug: Claude
- Planning: ChatGPT

Student Exercise (25 min)

  1. Open README.md in Cursor.
  2. Add project title, live link, screenshots, and learnings.
  3. Commit changes with message:
    docs: update README with screenshots

Mentor Tip

Encourage: â€œYouâ€™re not just building projects â€” youâ€™re building proof of learning.â€

Deliverable

âœ… README.md updated with visuals
âœ… Screenshot added
âœ… Commit pushed to GitHub

pages.title: Page 8: Public Launch â€” Your LinkedIn Post
pages.content:
Mentor Introduction

Say: â€œItâ€™s launch time! Letâ€™s announce your first project to the world.â€

Objective

  • Write a professional yet personal LinkedIn post
  • Share your live link and learnings
  • Build visibility as an AI Engineer

Mentor Demo (10 min)

Open LinkedIn â†’ New Post â†’ Copy this starter template:

ğŸš€ Week 1 of my AI Engineer Bootcamp â€” DONE!

âœ… Deployed my first app using Vercel
âœ… Learned to use .env securely
âœ… Debugged live builds with AI
âœ… Documented everything like a pro

What I built â†’ Quote Generator
ğŸ–¥ï¸ Live: https://quote-ai.vercel.app
ğŸ§  Stack: Next.js, Tailwind, TypeScript
ğŸ¤– AI Tools: ChatGPT, Cursor, Claude, V0

Biggest learning: AI doesnâ€™t replace engineers â€” it multiplies us.

#AIEngineering #WebDevelopment #LearnInPublic #NextJS #BuildInPublic

Student Exercise (25 min)

  1. Draft your post using the template.
  2. Ask ChatGPT: â€œMake my LinkedIn post sound more authentic and concise.â€
  3. Add your screenshot and live link.
  4. Post during class or after session.

Mentor Tip

Celebrate together â€” ask volunteers to share their posts in the group chat or on screen!

Deliverable

âœ… LinkedIn post published
âœ… Screenshot of post shared in group
âœ… Visibility started for your AI Engineer profile

pages.title: Page 9: Reflection & Graduation from Week 1 ğŸ“
pages.content:
Mentor Closing

Say with pride: â€œTake a deep breath â€” you just completed your first week as an AI Engineer!â€

Objective

  • Reflect on learnings, time saved, and mindset growth
  • Summarize key takeaways from the week
  • Prepare for Week 2 â€” Building MVPs

Mentor Reflection Discussion

Ask these three open questions to the class:

  1. What was your biggest â€˜aha!â€™ moment this week?
  2. How did AI change the way you code?
  3. What would you teach your past self before starting this bootcamp?

Student Exercise (20 min)

  1. Create a new file: WEEK1-REFLECTION.md.
  2. Fill this template:
# Week 1 Reflection

## Key Wins ğŸ¯
- Deployed first app
- Learned AI-assisted debugging
- Published LinkedIn post

## What I Struggled With âš¡
- Setting up SSH key
- Fixing Tailwind config
- Build errors

## My Favorite Tool ğŸ’¡
Cursor â€” instant debugging and code edits

## Next Goal ğŸš€
Build a real product MVP with AI guidance

## Stats ğŸ“Š
- Hours Spent: 15
- Projects Deployed: 1
- Bugs Solved: 8
- Time Saved (vs manual): 70%

Mentor Wrap-up Speech

Say: â€œYouâ€™ve proven you can build, deploy, debug, and share. Thatâ€™s what separates learners from builders. You are now officially an AI Engineer in training.â€

ğŸ‰ Play uplifting music, take screenshots, and cheer for everyone.

Next Step

  • âœ… Complete reflection commit:
    git add WEEK1-REFLECTION.md
    git commit -m 'docs: add week 1 reflection'
    git push origin main
  • âœ… Prepare for Week 2 â€” AI MVP Planning & Execution

Deliverable

âœ… WEEK1-REFLECTION.md pushed
âœ… Screenshot + LinkedIn post shared
âœ… Emotional closure of Week 1 ğŸ“
